results.title: Comparison of Effects of Metformin, Phenformin, and Inhibitors of Mitochondrial Complex I on Mitochondrial Permeability Transition and Ischemic Brain Injury
results.text_hl: The data suggest that, depending on the age, @CHEMICAL_Phenformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010629 @@@phenformin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may protect the brain against @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@ischemic damage@@@ possibly by suppressing MPTP via inhibition of mitochondrial Complex I.

citations.NLM: Skemiene K, Rekuviene E, Jekabsone A, Cizas P, Morkuniene R, Borutaite V. Comparison of Effects of Metformin, Phenformin, and Inhibitors of Mitochondrial Complex I on Mitochondrial Permeability Transition and Ischemic Brain Injury Biomolecules. 2020 Oct 1;10(10):. PMID: 33019635

results.title: AMPK mediates the anti-ferroptosis effect of acupuncture in cerebral ischemia-reperfusion rats.
results.text_hl: Further studies showed that acupuncture reduced the levels of Fe2+, @CHEMICAL_3_4_Methylenedioxyamphetamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015104 @@@MDA@@@ and the expression of @GENE_TFRC @GENE_64678 @@@TFR1@@@ protein and increased the expression of @GENE_SLC7A11 @GENE_310392 @@@SLC7A11@@@ and @GENE_GPX4 @GENE_29328 @@@GPX4@@@ protein in the diseased hippocampal region of MCAO/R @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@. In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, as an @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_78975 @@@AMPK@@@ activator, significantly enhanced the protective effect of acupuncture on @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@cerebral ischemic injury@@@ and enhanced the acupuncture-mediated reduction of Fe2+, @CHEMICAL_3_4_Methylenedioxyamphetamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015104 @@@MDA@@@ levels and @GENE_TFRC @GENE_64678 @@@TFR1@@@ protein expression and the increase of @GENE_SLC7A11 @GENE_310392 @@@SLC7A11@@@ and @GENE_GPX4 @GENE_29328 @@@GPX4@@@ protein expression in the lesioned hippocampal region of MCAO/R @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang R, Xu JF. AMPK mediates the anti-ferroptosis effect of acupuncture in cerebral ischemia-reperfusion rats. Brain Res. 2025 Apr 28;():149662. PMID: 40306606

results.title: Impact of Novel Guidelines on Multifactorial Control and Its Association with Mortality in Adult Patients with Hypertension and Newly Diagnosed Type 2 Diabetes: A 4-Year Prospective Multicenter Study
results.text_hl: Renin-angiotensin-aldosterone inhibitor, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and statin were prescribed in 89.8%, 66.3%, and 67.1%.

results.title: Possible protective mechanisms exerted by metformin or metformin and vitamin E in isoproterenol-induced cardiac injury.
results.text_hl: Several studies have reported that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is cardioprotective for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ and non-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@ischemic hearts@@@ through mechanisms that cannot be entirely attributed to its anti-@DISEASE_Hyperglycemic_Hyperosmolar_Nonketotic_Coma @DISEASE_MESH:D006944 @@@hyperglycemic@@@ effect.

results.title: Metformin therapy in diabetes: the role of cardioprotection.
results.text_hl: Consequently, treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ might potentially improve cardiovascular outcome in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ at risk for @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemia@@@, even if these @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ do not have @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@.

results.title: Comparative Impact of Hypoglycemic Agents on Severity and Extent of Myocardial Ischemia in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Undergoing Myocardial Perfusion Scintigraphy.
results.text_hl: Unadjusted analyses and analyses adjusting for baseline features suggested that @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylureas@@@ alone or in combination were associated with more severe @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ than nonsulfonylurea regimens (P < 0.05), whereas combination regimens including @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ were associated with more extensive @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemia@@@ than the other regimens (P < 0.05 for both).

citations.NLM: Biondi-Zoccai G, Pinto A, Versaci F, Procaccini E, Neri G, Sesti G, Uccioli L, Vetere M, Peruzzi M, Nudi F.
